microSituations.title: I'm Lost
actions: Find nearest metro station (look for 'M' signs)
Use Google Maps offline (download before trip)
Ask at info desk or police station
Look for major landmarks (Eiffel Tower, Notre-Dame)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't panic - Paris is walkable. Most attractions are within 30min walk of each other.

microSituations.title: Public Transport
actions: Get Navigo Easy card (‚Ç¨2) at any metro station
Single ride ‚Ç¨2.10, or carnet of 10 tickets ‚Ç¨19.10
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Avoid taxis during rush hour (5-7pm). Metro is faster and cheaper.

microSituations.title: Taxi / Ride Share
actions: Uber/Bolt available, but expensive (‚Ç¨15-30 short trips)
Official taxis: look for light on roof, meter required
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Use metro for most trips. Taxis only for late night or heavy luggage.

microSituations.title: Quick Bite
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't eat at tourist trap restaurants. Walk 2 blocks away for better prices.

microSituations.title: Sit-Down Meal
actions: Tipping: 10% if service good (service compris = tip included)
Say 'Je suis v√©g√©tarien' for vegetarian options
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Eat lunch like locals (12-2pm) for best deals. Dinner after 7:30pm.

microSituations.title: Dietary Restrictions
actions: Point at menu if language barrier
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't assume - always ask. French restaurants are accommodating.

microSituations.title: 15-30 Minutes
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't rush. Paris is best experienced slowly.

microSituations.title: 1-2 Hours
actions: Louvre (free first Sunday, book online to skip queue)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Avoid peak times (10am-2pm). Early morning or late afternoon is better.

microSituations.title: Half Day
actions: Versailles (early morning or late afternoon, book ahead)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't try to see everything. Pick one area and explore deeply.

microSituations.title: Safety Concern
actions: Avoid: Gare du Nord area late at night
Trust your instincts - leave if uncomfortable
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Paris is generally safe, but stay alert in tourist areas (pickpockets).

microSituations.title: Scam / Suspicious
actions: Ignore: fake petition signers (distraction for pickpockets)
Don't give money to aggressive beggars
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Be polite but firm: 'Non, merci' and keep walking.

microSituations.title: Lost Item
actions: Report to embassy if passport stolen
Cancel cards immediately if wallet stolen
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Keep copies of passport/ID separate. Use hotel safe for valuables.

microSituations.title: Essential Phrases
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't assume English. Always start with 'Bonjour' - it's polite.

microSituations.title: Ordering Food
actions: Menu items usually have English descriptions
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't be embarrassed. Locals appreciate any attempt at French.

microSituations.title: Asking for Help
actions: Use Google Translate app (offline mode available)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Younger Parisians usually speak English. Ask politely first.

microSituations.title: Need Rest
actions: Find a park: Jardin du Luxembourg, Tuileries (free)
Caf√© break (‚Ç¨2-4 for coffee, sit as long as you want)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't push through exhaustion. Rest is part of travel.

microSituations.title: Too Many Tourists
actions: Leave main areas: walk 10min away from Eiffel Tower
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Tourist areas are crowded for a reason, but real Paris is 2 blocks away.

microSituations.title: Overwhelmed by Choices
actions: Pick one thing: food OR museums OR shopping
Ask locals: 'Qu'est-ce que vous recommandez?' (what do you recommend?)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't try to see everything. One great experience beats ten rushed ones.

microSituations.title: If you have 15 minutes
actions: Watch street performers at Place Georges Pompidou
Discover a tiny street you've never heard of

microSituations.title: If you want something social
actions: Join locals at a wine bar (cave √† vin)
Visit a local market and chat with vendors
Find a p√©tanque game in a park
Attend a free concert (check local listings)

microSituations.title: If it's raining
actions: Explore covered passages (Galerie Vivienne, Passage des Panoramas)
Visit a museum (many free or cheap)
Caf√© culture: sit inside with a book
Underground shopping at Forum des Halles

microSituations.title: If you want local flavor
actions: Find a neighborhood bistro away from center

actions: RER B train: ‚Ç¨11.45, 35min to city center
